alert.note: Alert for Gosper; Harlan; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 04 at 9:45PM CDT until August 05 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN PHELPS...SOUTHERN GOSPER...FURNAS AND HARLAN COUNTIES... At 945 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Bertrand to Hendley to near Clayton, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. Between 926 PM CDT and 938 PM CDT trained weather spotters reported multiple wind gusts of 60 to 70 mph from Cambridge to around Holbrook. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Holdrege, Alma, Cambridge, Arapahoe, Oxford, Bertrand, Beaver City, Orleans, Loomis, Holbrook, Funk, Stamford, Republican City, Edison, Atlanta, Wilsonville, Huntley, Ragan, Hendley and Hollinger. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
